analysis: This webpage does not provide specific instructions for building or installing the 'vue' project from source code on a Debian/Ubuntu Linux system.
The provided webpage does not contain instructions on how to install or build the project 'vue' on a Debian/Ubuntu Linux system from source code.
The webpage does not provide instructions relevant to installing or building the project 'vue' on a Debian/Ubuntu Linux system from source code.

The webpage does provide instructions for installing Vue CLI on a Debian/Ubuntu Linux system from source code. Here are the steps and requirements:

1. Node.js version 8.9 or above is required (v10+ recommended).
2. You can manage multiple versions of Node on the same machine with n, nvm, or nvm-windows.
3. To install the Vue CLI package, use one of the following commands:
   - `npm install -g @vue/cli` 
   - `yarn global add @vue/cli`
4. After installation, you can access the vue binary in your command line.
5. To verify the installation, run `vue` in the command line, which should present you with a help message listing all available commands.
6. You can check the installed version by running `vue --version`.

If you wish to upgrade the global Vue CLI package, you can run:
- `npm update -g @vue/cli`
- `yarn global upgrade --latest @vue/cli`

For upgrading @vue/cli related packages inside your project, including packages starting with @vue/cli-plugin- or vue-cli-plugin- , you can run `vue upgrade` inside the project directory.

Unfortunately, specific instructions for building the project 'vue' from source code on a Debian/Ubuntu Linux system are not provided on the webpage.
The webpage does not provide instructions on how to install or build the project 'vue' from source code on a Debian/Ubuntu Linux system.
